intro: Phyllanthus tararae, commonly known as the Tararae spurge, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
